newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak crown strengthens after fix, seen firming.
newsitem.headline: Slovak crown strengthens after fix, seen firming.

text.p: The Slovak crown firmed some 80 basis points shortly after the National Bank of Slovakia (NBS) again fixed the currency stronger than market levels.
Local dealers said the NBS fixing will push the Slovak crown into a strengthening trend and that the currency will gradually move toward the levels at which the NBS fixed it.
The crown firmed to around 110 basis points on the depreciation side of its mark/dollar basket, from -1.96 percent versus the midpoint, after the NBS fixed it at -0.67 percent against the parity.
"This was another, and even stronger, signal from the NBS that the speculators will find it hard, or at least very expensive, to push the Slovak crown down," said one local trader.
On Thursday, the NBS fixed the crown ay -0.78 percent versus the parity.

"The crown was so weak before the fixing due to only small volumes traded among local banks, the foreigners seem not to be active at all at the moment," he said, adding the crown was likely to strengthen further as a reaction to the fixing.
Another Bratislava-based dealer said the NBS so far seemed to be winning the battle for the crown against foreign speculators, but he warned the fight was not completly over.
"They (NBS) seem to be doing it very well, mainly the by reducing access to crown funds and by using a strong fixing, but it is still early to celebrate the victory," he said.
"We still don't know how foreigner players will react to the new situation and if they would not seek a way of how to repeat their run on the crown again," the dealer added.
The Slovak and Czech crowns have for the past week been under strong speculative pressure, mainly from foreign banks.
While the Czech National Bank (CNB) this week intervened several times on the market to boost the ailing currency, the NBS has used only indirect intervention through its daily fix.

The CNB is reported to have used $1.5-2.0 billion in intervention to boost the Czech crown. The NBS is estimated to have bought around $350 million in exchange for for Slovak crowns at its fixing this week.
